title: What are some of the Skills/Mechanics of a champion that should actually belong to another champion.
body:
I think Taliyah's worked earth mechanic should belong to Yorick. The ground is super deep and massive so throwing a few stones shouldn't deplete the earth. Since Yorick's grave digger and I assume he summons ghouls by the dead bodies inside the ground, the worked earth mechanic makes sense on him. There should be limited dead bodies inside the ground so Yorick shouldn't be able to keep summoning ghouls on the same spot until the dead bodies are replenished with souls or whatever. This also fixes the anti-fun nature of his laning phase. I also think Mord's ultimate ability belongs to Yorick's. Yorick's a grave digger so he works with dead bodies. You know the dead champion bodies that stays flat on the ground after they died until the player is revived? Imagine Yorick's ultimate allows you to click on one of them and summon a ghost copy of that champion and function exactly like Mord's ultimate. 

These are my thoughts. I'm interested in hearing what you guys think.

Alright Meddler, hear out my idea.

http://i2.kym-cdn.com/photos/images/original/000/277/569/eb0.jpg

**Metal Gear**

I feel a lot of Urgot's kit lends itself to a mobile artillery platform as in the vein of a metal gear, and there is much potential for something in that vein.

See, without the Institute of War and Summoners keeping conflicts between warring states in check, the threat of unrestricted weaponized magic is now free to be used and abused, and the potential for arcanic weapons on the scale for nuclear weapons is quite possible in my opinion.

From there eventually the need to have a mobile nuclear artillery platform would inevitably result, and Urgot could be a perfect way to make this reality: such a dangerous weapon would likely find invention from Noxus and Zaun working in tandem, and Urgot as a decorated and loyal soldier - and who may face an unwanted end to his career - could be trusted to be part of the weapon... literally.

Fused to the artillery platform, he would be a living weapon capable of unfathomable destruction and serve in the name of Noxus.

The potential for such is unlimited.
https://66.media.tumblr.com/43f3d1dccc953b378c81621c3be1bcc6/tumblr_nvtdenDwIe1uycb9io1_400.gif

I'd rather have Urgot returned to his original classification of Marksman/Tank so that he can function in the enemy team.

The combination of artillery and gun on an armored body is the epitome of an actual Tank, like real millitary tank or Panzer.

Champions that are part tank/part damage class generally are not tanky enough to stand in the middle of the team because there should be some trade-off for getting that damage. The only champions that get tankiness AND damage are juggernauts who then get no way to get into the enemy team aside from slowly walking forward.

If Urgot was tanky enough to survive in the middle of the enemy team, and he has decent damage, and he has the range to put that damage on the enemy squishies when he gets into the middle of the enemy team, then you have a champion who is all strengths and no weaknesses.

> The only champions that get tankiness AND damage are juggernauts who then get no way to get into the enemy team aside from slowly walking forward.

this thread got me curious, but when did you guys start to allow all creativity for kits and not restricting them because they may be too difficult to play?

I remember when WK came out he had an ability planned that got scrapped for this very reason

We started shifting some focus from accessibility to distinctiveness in early 2012 and have continued to make distinctiveness of kits a priority since. Accessibility's still important to us, but we're happy to have more champions that have tough learning curves than we used to be, especially if they able to offer something really interesting as a result.

Ekko's W, hear me out cause at first I didn't really think about it for months and I wish I realized it on his release/teasers.

But ekko is an assassin giving him an AoE stun field which is also a great zoning tool should have been saved as an ability for a different champion or a rework.

Most of the issue the game has with tank ekko is yes due to mutliple slows and good base damage but those things are fine if ekko's W was reworked into something else.

His stun field is not only easier to use as a tank ekko but even as normal ekko albeit not as reliable it's still a powerful CC tool when riot clearly removed stun eve and silences from assassins(although not really a hard CC) to give them more counterplay of not having reliable/multilple hard-CCs (I count multiple/reliable 40%+ slows as perma-slow thus a hard CC btw which gives ekko mutliple hard ccs)

I'm not saying i'm 100% right but I do feel that ekko would be easier to fix if you removed his W and saved it for a new champ or a rework. 

Also in the future please don't give assassins reliable Multiple/AoE hard CCs because albeit ekko's w is hard to land at first once you put in practice it's rewarding hard CC is huge..

I know this entire post is off-topic but I really want to voice my feelings on ekko espeially when albeit it's been months I finnally realize it goes against the removal of stun eve and silences from assassins.
